doshas.name: Vata
doshas.primary_functions: Governs breathing, circulation, nerve impulses, muscle contractions, and elimination. Controls creativity, flexibility, and enthusiasm.

doshas.name: Pitta
doshas.primary_functions: Governs digestion, absorption, assimilation, and body temperature. Controls intelligence, understanding, and ambition.

doshas.name: Kapha
doshas.primary_functions: Provides structure, stability, and lubrication to the body. Maintains immunity, strength, and endurance.

herbs.name: Ashwagandha
herbs.description: An adaptogenic herb that helps manage stress, reduces anxiety, and improves strength.

herbs.name: Turmeric
herbs.description: A powerful anti-inflammatory and antioxidant herb.

herbs.name: Ginger (Fresh)
herbs.description: A warming herb that aids digestion and reduces inflammation.

herbs.name: Neem
herbs.description: A powerful bitter herb used for detoxification, skin health, and blood purification.

herbs.name: Brahmi
herbs.description: A renowned mental tonic, it enhances memory, concentration, and cognitive functions.

herbs.name: Tulsi (Holy Basil)
herbs.description: An adaptogenic herb known for its ability to reduce stress and support the immune system.

yoga_asanas.name: Cobra Pose
yoga_asanas.description: A heart-opening pose that helps reduce Pitta and Kapha.

yoga_asanas.name: Child's Pose
yoga_asanas.description: A calming, restorative pose that soothes the nervous system.

yoga_asanas.name: Seated Forward Bend
yoga_asanas.description: Reduces stress, calms the mind, and stretches the spine.

yoga_asanas.name: Sun Salutation (Slow)
yoga_asanas.description: A gentle, flowing sequence to promote grounding and warmth.

yoga_asanas.name: Sun Salutation (Rapid)
yoga_asanas.description: A vigorous sequence to build heat, energy, and circulation.

yoga_asanas.name: Moon Salutation
yoga_asanas.description: A cooling and calming sequence to soothe intensity.

pranayama.name: Alternate Nostril Breathing
pranayama.description: A balancing and purifying breath that calms the nervous system.

pranayama.name: Cooling Breath
pranayama.description: Involves breathing through a curled tongue to cool the body and mind.

pranayama.name: Bellows Breath
pranayama.description: A powerful and energizing breathing practice that increases vitality and clears congestion.

pranayama.name: Victorious Breath
pranayama.description: A warming and calming breath that can be used throughout asana practice to build internal heat.

early_morning.vata_recommendation: Wake up consistently around 6 AM to establish routine and ground Vata's mobile energy.
early_morning.pitta_recommendation: Wake up before sunrise (around 5:30-6 AM) to harness the cool, peaceful energy of the morning.
early_morning.kapha_recommendation: Wake up before 6 AM (ideally 4:30-5 AM) to prevent sluggishness and bring energy to the day.

early_morning.vata_recommendation: Gently scrape your tongue. Use warm sesame oil for oil pulling (Gandusha) to nourish tissues.
early_morning.pitta_recommendation: Scrape your tongue. Use cooling coconut oil for oil pulling to soothe inflammation.
early_morning.kapha_recommendation: Scrape your tongue thoroughly. Use warm sesame or sunflower oil for oil pulling to purify and clear congestion.

early_morning.vata_recommendation: Drink a glass of warm water, perhaps with a splash of lemon and ginger.
early_morning.pitta_recommendation: Drink a glass of room temperature or cool water, possibly with a little lime.
early_morning.kapha_recommendation: Drink a glass of warm water with a teaspoon of honey and lemon to stimulate metabolism.

morning.vata_recommendation: Perform a daily warm sesame oil self-massage to nourish dry skin and calm the nervous system.
morning.pitta_recommendation: Use cooling oils like coconut or sunflower oil for self-massage, especially on the head and feet.
morning.kapha_recommendation: Perform a vigorous, stimulating dry-brush (Garshana) *before* a light massage with warm mustard or sesame oil to improve circulation.

morning.vata_recommendation: Engage in gentle, grounding yoga, Tai Chi, or walking. Avoid overly strenuous exercise.
morning.pitta_recommendation: Practice cooling and calming yoga, swim, or take a walk in nature. Avoid exercising in the midday heat.
morning.kapha_recommendation: Perform vigorous, heating exercise like running, cycling, or a strong vinyasa yoga flow to build heat and clear congestion.

morning.vata_recommendation: Eat a warm, nourishing, and grounding breakfast, like oatmeal or a root vegetable hash.
morning.pitta_recommendation: Eat a substantial, cooling breakfast, such as a fruit smoothie, toast with ghee, or a sweet rice porridge.
morning.kapha_recommendation: Eat a light, warm breakfast, or skip it entirely if you don't feel hungry. A spiced-up fruit stew is a good option.

mid_day.vata_recommendation: Eat your main meal between 12-1 PM in a calm, settled environment. Focus on warm, cooked, and oily foods.
mid_day.pitta_recommendation: Eat your largest meal at noon when digestive fire (Agni) is strongest. Favor cooling foods and avoid spicy or fried items.
mid_day.kapha_recommendation: Eat a moderately sized, well-spiced, warm, and light lunch. Avoid heavy, cold, or excessively oily foods.

mid_day.vata_recommendation: Take a short, 5-10 minute gentle walk to aid digestion.
mid_day.pitta_recommendation: Take a short, 5-10 minute walk in a cool, shaded area. Avoid direct, hot sun.
mid_day.kapha_recommendation: Take a 10-15 minute walk to stimulate digestion and avoid sluggishness. Avoid napping.

evening.vata_recommendation: Eat a light, warm, and simple meal (like a hearty soup or kitchari) at least 3 hours before bed.
evening.pitta_recommendation: Eat a moderately light, cooling dinner. Avoid spicy, heavy, or sour foods in the evening.
evening.kapha_recommendation: Eat a very light, warm, and dry dinner (e.g., a simple soup, steamed vegetables). It's the smallest meal of the day.

evening.vata_recommendation: Engage in calming activities. Listen to gentle music, read a relaxing book. Avoid intense TV or stimulating conversations.
evening.pitta_recommendation: Spend time in nature, meditate, or have a pleasant, light-hearted conversation. Avoid work or arguments.
evening.kapha_recommendation: Stay lightly active. Tidy up the house or go for a short, gentle walk. Avoid sinking into the couch right after dinner.

night.vata_recommendation: Turn off screens an hour before bed. A warm bath or a cup of warm, spiced milk can help. Aim to be in bed by 10 PM.
night.pitta_recommendation: Turn off screens and cool down. Read a book, meditate. Aim to be in bed by 10 PM to utilize the cooling, restorative part of the night.
night.kapha_recommendation: Turn off screens. Aim to be in bed by 10 PM, but no later than 11 PM, to ensure you can wake up early.

lifestyle_adjustments.vata_recommendation: Maintain a consistent daily schedule, including regular times for sleeping, waking, and eating to ground Vata's mobile nature.
lifestyle_adjustments.pitta_recommendation: Incorporate periods of calm and leisure into your day to cool Pitta's intensity. Avoid over-scheduling.
lifestyle_adjustments.kapha_recommendation: Wake up early, before 6 AM, and engage in vigorous morning exercise to counteract Kapha's sluggishness.

lifestyle_adjustments.vata_recommendation: Sit down to eat your meals in a calm environment. Avoid eating on the go or while distracted.
lifestyle_adjustments.pitta_recommendation: Eat in a peaceful setting and avoid heated or controversial discussions during meals.
lifestyle_adjustments.kapha_recommendation: Practice mindful eating and avoid overeating. Make lunch your largest meal and keep dinner light.

lifestyle_adjustments.vata_recommendation: Aim for a regular sleep schedule, going to bed by 10 PM. A warm bath or a cup of herbal tea before bed can be calming.
lifestyle_adjustments.pitta_recommendation: Ensure your bedroom is cool and dark. Avoid stimulating activities or arguments before bedtime.
lifestyle_adjustments.kapha_recommendation: Avoid daytime naps and aim to be in bed by 10 PM, waking up early to prevent sluggishness.

lifestyle_adjustments.vata_recommendation: Opt for gentle, grounding exercises like walking, swimming, tai chi, or restorative yoga.
lifestyle_adjustments.pitta_recommendation: Choose cooling and non-competitive exercises like swimming, hiking in nature, or cycling. Avoid exercising in the midday heat.
lifestyle_adjustments.kapha_recommendation: Engage in vigorous, stimulating activities like jogging, dancing, or high-intensity interval training (HIIT) to boost metabolism.

late_autumn_winter.guideline: Focus on warm, nourishing foods and a stable routine. Protect yourself from cold and wind.

spring.guideline: Favor light, dry, and warm foods. Increase physical activity to counteract sluggishness.

summer.guideline: Eat cooling, non-spicy foods. Avoid excessive sun exposure and stay hydrated.
